chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Dennis H Wagner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and IS Eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Sex offender counseling/treatment as deemed appropriate by agent. Register as a sex offender (life time).

No Contact with victim J.M. No unsupervised contact with any minors. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Follow thraough with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: As a condition of probation, non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. Commencing forthwith. LAST 6 months are STAYED.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dennis H Wagner in court with Attorney Thomas C Simon.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Simon gives statements regarding sentencing.  3 of Defendant's family members make statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

15 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - _ days)
  -  7 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  8 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

TERM OF PROBATION:  10 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____No contact with victim J.M.
____No unsupervised contact with any minors
____Register as sex offender (life time)
____Sex offender counseling/treatmen, as deemed appropriate by agent 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  12 MONTHS (LAST 6 MONTHS STAYED) Non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence forthwith

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Dated 09/09/14, from Atty Simon to Judge Carter, with attached character letters.
Sentencing hearing on September 15, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
